489: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
490: 		NodeType:    "slack:send_dm",
491: 		Name:        "Slack: Send Direct Message",
492: 		Description: "Sends a direct message to a Slack user",
493: 		Category:    NodeCategoryIntegration,
494: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
495: 			"type": "object",
496: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
497: 				"user_id": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
498: 				"text":    map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
499: 			},
500: 		},
501: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
502: 			"user_id": "${steps.lookup.output.slack_user_id}",
503: 			"text":    "You have a new task assigned",
504: 		},
505: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to send direct messages to Slack users. Specify user ID (not username) and message text.",
506: 		IsActive:       true,
507: 	})

466: 	// Integrations
467: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
468: 		NodeType:    "slack:send_message",
469: 		Name:        "Slack: Send Message",
470: 		Description: "Sends a message to a Slack channel",
471: 		Category:    NodeCategoryIntegration,
472: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
473: 			"type": "object",
474: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
475: 				"channel": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
476: 				"text":    map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
477: 				"blocks":  map[string]interface{}{"type": "array"},
478: 			},
479: 		},
480: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
481: 			"channel": "#general",
482: 			"text":    "New alert: ${steps.data.output.message}",
483: 		},
484: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to send messages to Slack channels. Specify channel name (e.g., #general) or ID " +
485: 			"and message text. Supports Block Kit for rich formatting.",
486: 		IsActive: true,
487: 	})

444: 
445: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
446: 		NodeType:    "control:parallel",
447: 		Name:        "Parallel",
448: 		Description: "Executes multiple branches in parallel",
449: 		Category:    NodeCategoryControl,
450: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
451: 			"type": "object",
452: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
453: 				"error_strategy":  map[string]interface{}{"type": "string", "enum": []string{"fail_fast", "wait_all"}},
454: 				"max_concurrency": map[string]interface{}{"type": "integer"},
455: 			},
456: 		},
457: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
458: 			"error_strategy":  "fail_fast",
459: 			"max_concurrency": 5,
460: 		},
461: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to run multiple branches simultaneously. Choose 'fail_fast' to stop on first error " +
462: 			"or 'wait_all' to complete all branches regardless of errors.",
463: 		IsActive: true,
464: 	})

426: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
427: 		NodeType:    "control:delay",
428: 		Name:        "Delay",
429: 		Description: "Pauses workflow execution for a specified duration",
430: 		Category:    NodeCategoryControl,
431: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
432: 			"type": "object",
433: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
434: 				"duration": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
435: 			},
436: 		},
437: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
438: 			"duration": "5s",
439: 		},
440: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to pause the workflow. Specify duration as '5s' (seconds), '2m' (minutes), or '1h' (hours). " +
441: 			"Can also use variables: '${steps.config.output.delay}'.",
442: 		IsActive: true,
443: 	})

400: 
401: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
402: 		NodeType:    "control:loop",
403: 		Name:        "Loop (For Each)",
404: 		Description: "Iterates over an array executing child nodes for each item",
405: 		Category:    NodeCategoryControl,
406: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
407: 			"type": "object",
408: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
409: 				"source":         map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
410: 				"item_variable":  map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
411: 				"index_variable": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
412: 				"max_iterations": map[string]interface{}{"type": "integer"},
413: 			},
414: 		},
415: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
416: 			"source":         "${steps.data.output.items}",
417: 			"item_variable":  "item",
418: 			"index_variable": "index",
419: 			"max_iterations": 100,
420: 		},
421: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to process each item in an array. Specify the source array and variable names. " +
422: 			"Nodes inside the loop can access ${loop.item} for the current item and ${loop.index} for the index.",
423: 		IsActive: true,
424: 	})

379: 	// Control flow
380: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
381: 		NodeType:    "control:if",
382: 		Name:        "Conditional (If/Else)",
383: 		Description: "Branches workflow based on a condition",
384: 		Category:    NodeCategoryControl,
385: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
386: 			"type": "object",
387: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
388: 				"condition":   map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
389: 				"description": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
390: 			},
391: 		},
392: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
393: 			"condition":   "${steps.data.output.status} == \"approved\"",
394: 			"description": "Check if status is approved",
395: 		},
396: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to branch workflow logic based on conditions. Write a condition that evaluates to true/false. " +
397: 			"Connect 'true' and 'false' edges to different downstream nodes for conditional branching.",
398: 		IsActive: true,
399: 	})

353: 
354: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
355: 		NodeType:    "action:email",
356: 		Name:        "Send Email",
357: 		Description: "Sends email notifications",
358: 		Category:    NodeCategoryAction,
359: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
360: 			"type": "object",
361: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
362: 				"to":      map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
363: 				"subject": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
364: 				"body":    map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
365: 				"cc":      map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
366: 				"bcc":     map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
367: 			},
368: 		},
369: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
370: 			"to":      "user@example.com",
371: 			"subject": "Workflow Alert",
372: 			"body":    "Data processed: ${steps.process.output.count} items",
373: 		},
374: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to send email notifications. Configure recipients, subject, and body. " +
375: 			"Use template variables like ${steps.nodeName.output.field} for dynamic content.",
376: 		IsActive: true,
377: 	})

332: 
333: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
334: 		NodeType:    "action:formula",
335: 		Name:        "Formula",
336: 		Description: "Evaluates mathematical or logical expressions",
337: 		Category:    NodeCategoryAction,
338: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
339: 			"type": "object",
340: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
341: 				"expression":      map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
342: 				"output_variable": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
343: 			},
344: 		},
345: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
346: 			"expression":      "${steps.data.output.price} * ${steps.data.output.quantity} * 1.1",
347: 			"output_variable": "total_with_tax",
348: 		},
349: 		LLMDescription: "Use this for calculations. Write expressions using ${variable} syntax. " +
350: 			"Supports math operators (+, -, *, /), comparisons (==, !=, <, >), and logical operators (&&, ||, !).",
351: 		IsActive: true,
352: 	})

311: 
312: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
313: 		NodeType:    "action:code",
314: 		Name:        "JavaScript Code",
315: 		Description: "Executes custom JavaScript code",
316: 		Category:    NodeCategoryAction,
317: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
318: 			"type": "object",
319: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
320: 				"script":  map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
321: 				"timeout": map[string]interface{}{"type": "integer"},
322: 			},
323: 		},
324: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
325: 			"script":  "const input = context.steps.transform.output;\nreturn { processed: input.data.map(x => x * 2) };",
326: 			"timeout": 30,
327: 		},
328: 		LLMDescription: "Use this for complex logic that cannot be expressed with other nodes. " +
329: 			"Write JavaScript code that returns an object. Access previous steps via context.steps.nodeName.output.",
330: 		IsActive: true,
331: 	})

288: 
289: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
290: 		NodeType:    "action:transform",
291: 		Name:        "Transform Data",
292: 		Description: "Transforms and maps data between steps",
293: 		Category:    NodeCategoryAction,
294: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
295: 			"type": "object",
296: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
297: 				"expression": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
298: 				"mapping":    map[string]interface{}{"type": "object"},
299: 			},
300: 		},
301: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
302: 			"mapping": map[string]interface{}{
303: 				"user_name":  "${steps.trigger.body.user.name}",
304: 				"user_email": "${steps.trigger.body.user.email}",
305: 			},
306: 		},
307: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to reshape, filter, or combine data. Create mappings to extract and rename fields " +
308: 			"from previous steps. Use ${steps.nodeName.output.field} syntax for variable references.",
309: 		IsActive: true,
310: 	})

261: 	// Actions
262: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
263: 		NodeType:    "action:http",
264: 		Name:        "HTTP Request",
265: 		Description: "Makes HTTP API calls to external services",
266: 		Category:    NodeCategoryAction,
267: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
268: 			"type": "object",
269: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
270: 				"method":  map[string]interface{}{"type": "string", "enum": []string{"GET", "POST", "PUT", "PATCH", "DELETE"}},
271: 				"url":     map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
272: 				"headers": map[string]interface{}{"type": "object"},
273: 				"body":    map[string]interface{}{"type": "object"},
274: 				"timeout": map[string]interface{}{"type": "integer"},
275: 			},
276: 		},
277: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
278: 			"method":  "POST",
279: 			"url":     "https://api.example.com/data",
280: 			"headers": map[string]interface{}{"Content-Type": "application/json"},
281: 			"body":    map[string]interface{}{"key": "${steps.trigger.body.value}"},
282: 			"timeout": 30,
283: 		},
284: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to call REST APIs. Configure the HTTP method, URL, headers, and request body. " +
285: 			"Supports template variables like ${steps.trigger.body.data} for dynamic values from previous steps.",
286: 		IsActive: true,
287: 	})

240: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
241: 		NodeType:    "trigger:schedule",
242: 		Name:        "Schedule Trigger",
243: 		Description: "Starts workflow on a cron schedule",
244: 		Category:    NodeCategoryTrigger,
245: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
246: 			"type": "object",
247: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
248: 				"cron":     map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
249: 				"timezone": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
250: 			},
251: 		},
252: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
253: 			"cron":     "0 9 * * 1-5",
254: 			"timezone": "America/New_York",
255: 		},
256: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to run a workflow automatically at scheduled times. " +
257: 			"Specify a cron expression (e.g., '0 9 * * 1-5' for 9am weekdays) and optional timezone.",
258: 		IsActive: true,
259: 	})

215: 	// Triggers
216: 	registry.Register(NodeTemplate{
217: 		NodeType:    "trigger:webhook",
218: 		Name:        "Webhook Trigger",
219: 		Description: "Starts workflow when an HTTP webhook is received",
220: 		Category:    NodeCategoryTrigger,
221: 		ConfigSchema: map[string]interface{}{
222: 			"type": "object",
223: 			"properties": map[string]interface{}{
224: 				"path":      map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
225: 				"auth_type": map[string]interface{}{"type": "string", "enum": []string{"none", "basic", "signature", "api_key"}},
226: 				"secret":    map[string]interface{}{"type": "string"},
227: 			},
228: 		},
229: 		ExampleConfig: map[string]interface{}{
230: 			"path":      "/my-webhook",
231: 			"auth_type": "signature",
232: 			"secret":    "my-secret",
233: 		},
234: 		LLMDescription: "Use this to start a workflow when an external system sends an HTTP POST request. " +
235: 			"Configure authentication (none, basic auth, signature verification, or API key) for security. " +
236: 			"The webhook payload will be available in subsequent steps via ${steps.trigger.body}.",
237: 		IsActive: true,
238: 	})
